title: Showers above 75mm expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Hambantota districts today (26).

title: Colombo HC mulls action over online comments against judge in Rajapaksa’s Krrish case
byline: The Colombo High Court Registrar has reported to the court regarding two posts posted on social media against Colombo High Court Judge Manjula Thilakaratne, who is hearing the money laundering case filed against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa in connection with the controversial ‘Krrish’ project.

title: ‘Tear down barriers and unite as one’ – President’s Maha Shivaratri message
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake called on Sri Lankans to tear down the barriers that have kept everyone apart for generations and unite as one, casting aside discord and embracing togetherness.

title: Another suspect arrested over Middeniya triple homicide
byline: Police have arrested another suspect in connection with the recent triple homicide in Middeniya, in which the father and his two children were shot dead while riding on a motorcycle.

title: First batch of imported personal vehicles arrives at Colombo Port after 5-year hiatus
byline: The first batch of vehicles imported for private use arrived at the Colombo Port on Tuesday (25), following the Sri Lankan government’s decision to ease import restrictions after a five-year hiatus.

title: Namal Rajapaksa arrives at CID to record statement over Airbus deal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramina (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning (26).

title: 6.1 magnitude earthquake strikes near Indonesia’s Sulawesi
byline: A shallow 6.1-magnitude earthquake hit near the Indonesian island of Sulawesi on Wednesday (February 26, 2025), the United States Geological Survey said, forcing residents to flee outside but with no damage or casualties reported.

title: Indian woman arrested with Kush cannabis worth Rs. 12 million at BIA
byline: The officers attached to the Narcotics Control Unit of Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have arrested an Indian woman with 1.2 kg of Kush cannabis who had arrived from Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Suspect in Ambalangoda double murder remanded after surrendering to court
byline: A suspect wanted in connection with a double murder committed in the Urawatta area of the Ambalangoda Police Division has surrendered to the Balapitiya Magistrate’s Court through a lawyer.

title: Maha Kumbh Mela: World’s largest religious gathering wraps up after 600 million devotees take holy dip
byline: Hundreds of millions of Hindu devotees have bathed in sacred waters, despite concerns over overcrowding and water pollution, as the world’s largest religious gathering wrapped up Wednesday in India’s northern state of Uttar Pradesh.

title: Trump floats $5 million ‘gold card’ as a route to US citizenship
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday floated the idea of replacing a visa program for foreign investors with a so-called “gold card” that could be bought for $5 million as a route to American citizenship.

title: One injured in shooting in Minuwangoda
byline: One person has been injured in a shooting incident at Paththanduwana Junction in Minuwangoda today (26), the police said.

title: 2025 Budget: Entrepreneurs voice concern over proposed private sector salary
byline: The Sri Lanka United National Businesses Alliance (SLUNBA) has expressed concerns over the government’s proposal to increase private sector salaries, stating that such an increase is not currently feasible.

title: Shell’s first fuel station opened in Sri Lanka
byline: The first Shell branded fuel station has opened in Sri Lanka at B.S. Cooray Filling Station, Ambathale.

title: More than 20 killed after Sudanese army plane crashes in residential area
byline: A Sudanese army plane crashed on Tuesday in a residential area near the Wadi Seidna military airport in northern Omdurman killing more than 20 people, including military personnel and civilians, military and medical sources said on Wednesday.

title: Police foil assassination plot in revenge over ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder
byline: Sri Lanka Police have successfully thwarted an attempt to assassinate the parents of the wife of underworld figure infamously known as “Kehelbaddara Padme” in an apparent act of retaliation for the murder of notorious underworld figure “Ganemulla Sanjeewa”.

title: Security in all prisons to be enhanced with upgraded jammers
byline: Measures have been taken to implement a special security program in all prisons across the country.
